definition: to nip in the bud (idiom)
to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
tiny/miniature/slightly/profound/abtruse/to decline/one millionth part of/micro-/Taiwan pr. [wei2]
surname Wei/ancient Chinese state near present day Chongqing/Taiwan pr. [Wei2]
surname Du
birchleaf pear (tree)/to stop/to prevent/to restrict
to imbue
gradual/gradually

sentences.english: But truth is, many of us need a little help.
sentences.chinese: 但事实上，许多人都需要一点帮助来防微杜渐。

sentences.english: How can teenagers keep away from tobacco?Should adults be banned from smoking as well?
sentences.chinese: 作为青少年，我们怎样才能远离吸烟人群，防微杜渐？

sentences.english: The government and the media should take immediate actions to combat this issue.
sentences.chinese: 因此政府和媒体要及时采取措施，防微杜渐。

definition: see 防患未然[fang2 huan4 wei4 ran2]
to prevent troubles before the event (idiom)/to forestall/to nip sth in the bud
to accumulate tiny quantities (idiom)
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
to think of danger in times of safety/to be vigilant in peacetime (idiom)
an ant hole may cause the collapse of a great dike (idiom)/huge damage may result from a moment's negligence
pinyin: qian1 li3 zhi1 di1 , kui4 yu2 yi3 xue2

definition: lit. to punish those before to prevent those after (idiom); to criticize former mistakes firmly to prevent them happening again
lit. to mend the pen after sheep are lost (idiom)/fig. to act belatedly/better late than never/to lock the stable door after the horse has bolted
lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster/to cherish a viper in one's bosom
correct any mistakes you made, but maintain your good record if you did not make them (idiom)
pinyin: you3 ze2 gai3 zhi1 , wu2 ze2 jia1 mian3

definition: to put an end to
to be strict with oneself (idiom)/to demand a lot of oneself
to be strict with oneself
hiding a sickness for fear of treatment (idiom); fig. concealing a fault to avoid criticism/to keep one's shortcomings secret/to refuse to listen to advice
one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
to be alert
